The goal of the game is to extricate each country from dangerous circumstances and achieve global prosperity with the least amount of military intervention. As “nation teams,” students will gain greater understanding of the critical impact of information and how it is used.

As their teams venture further into this interactive social setting laced with highly charged philosophical issues, the skills needed to identify ambiguity and bias in the information they receive will be enhanced and more specifically they will rapidly perceive that reactive behavior not only provokes antagonism, it can leave them alone and isolated in the face of powerful enemies. Beliefs and values will evolve or completely unravel as they begin to experience the positive impact and windows of opportunity that emerge through effective collaboration and refined communication.

In essence, as meaning is constructed out of chaos and new creative solutions are proposed, the World Peace Game players will learn to live and work comfortably at the frontiers of the unknown.

97827.name: Race For The Cup
97827.description:
Subtitled: "An America's Cup Yacht Race Game"

Box Description:

"Race For The Cup" is a fun and exciting game about America's Cup Yacht racing. But you don't have to be a "Yachtie" to play!

Suitable for 2-6 players it's just like real Yacht Racing involving both luck and judgement.

Before the actual race starts each player accumulates assets (cash and insurance) then the race beings. Players sail their yachts around the America's Cup course trying to avoid problems and taking advantage of windfalls. The first yacht across the line is the winner!"

97828.name: irre genug: 120 verdrehte Begriffe und Quizfragen
97828.description:
2 - 5 players (groups) struggle for finding correct terms first
Developed for educational purposes - but can be inspiring for gamers to short pauses in between game sessions;
'irre genug' is a card game issued by the Bundeszentrale für politische Bildung of Germany. The game has 60 cards, each one depicting two different terms, describing either institutions, items, professions, geographic areas or society. On each card you see skewed hints which may trigger some unused brain areas to find the correct solution
Goal: Collect 10 points - finishing first. (score 2/1 point(s) per proper answer)

1 Moderator draws one card and asks the question
2 Anyone may answer within 30 s - correct: 2 points
3 Moderator gives hint(s) - more detailed
4 Anyone may answer within 30 s - correct: 1 point
5 Moderator scores 2 points
6 Moderator changes

There are different variations for scoring players may choose in the beginning
Disadvantage: Due to number of drawing cards (60) limited suitability

97830.name: DSF Basketballmanager 2008
97830.description:
User Summary:

DSF Basketballmanager 2008 is a management game, where you take control of a basketball team based in the german basketball league. As known from other management games you try to buy the best team, organize the best trainings and do all the marketing stuff.

97831.name: Goin' Downtown
97831.description:
User Summary:

Goin' Downtown is a Point and Click Adventure based in a Science-Fiction scenario. The main character is the police officer Jack who is trying to solve the murder case of a prostitute.

97832.name: Pro Cycling Manager: Season 2008
97832.description:
User Summary:

This is the 2008 Edition of the cycling management game "Pro Cycling Manager" in which you try to organize a cycling team.

97833.name: Fool's Gold (Special PDF)
97833.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Fool’s Gold is an Aces & Eights adventure set in Lazarus, a boomtown on the rise, and the hills of El Diablo’s Caldera, land coveted by Imperial Mexico, the Republic of Texas, Deseret, and the United States, but occupied by “heathens, squatters, Indians and bandits.”

A strange influx of gold nuggets has caused a great deal of interest among the townsfolk of Lazarus, but is all that glitters really gold? Does a strange, solitary prospector hold the answers – or is it the local Apache – or a notorious gang of bandits? And whatever happened to the missing prospectors – or to the ghost town of Christian’s Folly? Attempting to answer these questions reveals ominous hints that everything is not what it seems. What ensues puts the players on the path to the solution, but the odds are against them, and many encounters await them within the dusty hills. Even what seems like success may be merely a prelude to revenge…

As well as providing adventures in town, wilderness, and subterranean settings, this special bookmarked 95 page PDF includes hooks for various types of player characters, plus local rumors, several reference and area maps, non-player character sheets in our popular Rustlers & Townsfolk format, and more, all in an easy to use format. Even after the players finish the adventure, you can use the supplemental material again and again. From subtle intrigue to intense action-packed combat, you’ll find hours of fun in this new and compelling adventure for your western campaign.

95 pages including maps and NPC sheets, b&w and color)

97834.name: Öko Simulator
97834.description:
User Summary:

In this management like game you try to get an working economy system. The clue about this game is, that the focus lies on enviromental care, so it is important to build the system without destroying nature.

97835.name: Cthuloide Welten (Issue 20 - Apr 2011)
97835.description:
(user summary)
table of content:

editorial
news
Wuchernder Wahn - scenario in Berlin
Staub zu Staub - scenario near Arkham
Connected - scenario for Cthulhu Now
Resolution Zero - the truth about the Montains of Madness
libraries and recherche in CoC
Die Verabredung nach dem Tode - a story from the middle ages
Cthulhu.de - interview
Eine Geschichte, viele Facetten - on gamemastering
Unspeakable Vault of Doom - comic

97836.name: Advance Junior
97836.description: Board game in which each player has three tanks which attempt to get to the opponent's home base. Movement is by dice, but in order to be permitted to move or to make an attack, a nifty resolution mechanism is used. 2 batteries power a bulb and this is reflected by turning knobs controlled by the players. Essentially the two players each secretly pick one of red, green or yellow (colours which are also marked on the tanks), and then a fire button is pressed to illuminate the lights. Whether the action succeeds or not depends on whether the lights match or not.

97837.name: Mouse Hell
97837.description:
A mouse trapped in hell, pit of darkness with evil cat demons; trying to escape on a paper glider. It is not easy to survive too far. Watch out the falling rocks from above, the fire balls coming from deep down and hands trying to grab you.

Source: The Developer Website.

97838.name: Alibi
97838.description: Highly collectable detective game from this famous British author of detective and horror stories. The rule book outlines a detailed scenario in which a murder has taken place and one of six infamous criminals must be to blame. The players are detectives and move around a map of Britain and in various towns get to look at one of the cards which may help provide an alibi for one of the suspects, advance the investigation further or merely cause a delay. When enough information has been gathered a player can race back to the town the murderer is in and arrest him to win. Nice system which ensures it plays differently each time. Includes metal detective figures.

97839.name: Money Go Round
97839.description: Family business game which reuses many of the ideas from Monopoly. The theme is a trip to the fairground, and players travel around a figure of eight shaped track landing on various spaces, which include actions such as finding 10p on a park bench, or missing a bus, as well as the various attractions which can be bought and will then earn admission fees from other players landing on them. If a set of related stalls are bought then the admission goes up, and advertising chips can be bought to further increase admission costs. The Fair Manager's Office replaces Jail and so on. All the money is in small numbers of £ and p with realistic card coins and paper notes, making it a useful game to teach children to deal with money too.

97840.name: Quick-Wits
97840.description: Card game, featuring cards giving a range of categories, and a second deck of letters. There are several variations, but the basic idea is that players must name something which fits the current category and starts with the current letter.

97841.name: Gyrotate
97841.description:
Finally! The innovate action-puzzle game that you've been waiting for. Amazingly simple yet insanely addictive, once you start you won't be able to stop!

Designed specifically for the iPod/iPhone touchscreen. Match 4 or more pieces of the same colour by rotationg layers on the board.

Every piece you match reduces your quota for that color, progress through each level by making enough matches to reduce all quotas to zero.

It sounds easy, but as you complete each level the quota increases and the timebar decreases at a faster rate. So you'll need all your skill and concentration to keep going.

-Unique and addictive gameplay
-An intuitive control scheme designed specifially fr the iPhone touch screen
-Endless hours of replayability
-Special pieces, such as bombs and locks enhance the gameplay and strategy needed.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgamehonor: 2012 Golden Geek Best Strategy Board Game Nominee
2012 Golden Geek Most Innovative Board Game Nominee
2012 International Gamers Award - General Strategy: Multi-player Nominee
97842.description:
In his last will, your rich uncle stated that all of his millions will go to the nephew who can enjoy money the most. How to find out which nephew should be rich? You will each be given a large amount of money and whoever can spend it first will be the rightful heir. Visit the most exclusive theatres or eat in the most expensive restaurants. Buy old properties for the price of new ones and sell them as ruins. Host a huge party in your mansion or on your private boat. Spend like your life would depend on it. Spend to become rich! If you're the first to run through the money on hand, you'll receive the rest of his inheritance – oh, and win the game.

In Last Will, each player starts with a certain amount of money, an individual player board, two errand boys and two cards in some combination of properties and helpers. At the start of each round, lay out cards from the appropriate decks on the offering boards; the four regular decks are properties, companions, events, helpers and expenses, with special cards forming a deck of their own. The particular mix of cards varies by round and by the number of players.

Each player then chooses a plan for the round, with each plan indicating the number of cards the player draws (drawn immediately from the four regular decks in any combination), how many errand boys he can use later (one or two), the number of actions available to him that round, and his spot in the playing order that round. In the playing order for that round, players then take turns choosing an action with their errand boy(s), with those actions being:


Take a card on display and add it to your hand.
Draw a card from any regular deck – This can be chosen only once by each player.
Visit the opera and spend $2.
Adjust the value modifiers in the property market.
Take a player board extension, thereby giving you room to play more cards.


Players then take actions in the playing order for that round, with each player having as many actions as indicated on his plan. Actions let you play one-time events (which have a cost, possibly variable); helpers and recurring expenses (which are placed on your individual player board); and properties (which cost money and may depreciate over time). You can often play companions with events or recurring expenses – of course you should bring a date to the opera or a horse on your yacht! – to increase their cost. You can also use actions to activate cards on your player board, possibly with one or more companions and always with the goal of spending money. Helpers and special cards can provide you with unique powers to further boost your profligacy.

At the end of each round, you must discard down to two cards in hand, and properties that can depreciate do so; this is good as a player cannot go bankrupt if he owns properties, and the only way to get rid of properties is to sell them, which regretably puts money back in your hands unless the depreciation was intense or you manipulate the market.

If a player has no money and no properties, he declares bankruptcy and the game ends at the conclusion of that round; otherwise the game ends after seven rounds. The player who has the least money (or even who is most in debt) wins.
97842.name: Last Will
boardgamepodcastepisode: 11-30-15: Thanksgaming! Last Will, Dice Town, Specter Ops, and brewery memberships
AP Podcast – Episodio 9: Copycat y Last Will
House Rules 47: Discussing the Top Five
Low Player Count - Ep. 2 - I Know What You Did Last Turn
TDT - Episode # 322 - Games from our Childhood

97843.name: The Ruins of the Dammed
97843.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Cursed Aran county has been divided between two factions for generations. Tension is high and war between the two appears close at hand. There is a dam on a river in the north county that controls water that flows to the south's farmers. Recently the north restricted the flow south, and an unknown party attacked the dam to reverse the situation.

Working for one side or the other (the player's choice) the party must travel to the valley holding the dam and determine who is bahind the trouble there. Then the party must decide if they will intervene for either the north or the south over the water flow issue. This is primarily an outdoor adventure but there are encounters in other terrain types.

97844.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Bound together by their ideology and the calling in their soul, Sister Evangeline and Kronen Roxxon work tirelessly to fight the awakening darkness.

Sister Evangeline:

From the moment of her birth, Evangeline was blessed and dammed with special abilities which made her different from other people. Now, under the severe supervision of the church, she has developed her mystical powers to serve the 13 bishop.

Mystic - Light Church - Level 50

Holy Armor (Magic, Effect) - One target friendly unit gains Lv2 Shield.

Blessing (Magic, Effect ) - All friendly units inside Evangeline's Control Zone gain +1 to Attack and Defense. Upkeep: o

Vision (Magic, Effect) - Detect any hidden unit inside Evangeline's Control Zone.

Healing (Magic, Effect) - Heal 5 Life Points of a friendly unit inside Evangeline's Control Zone.

Kronen Roxxon:

As one of the high knights of the empire, Kronen is an impressive warrior with outstanding combat skills. Wearing heavy full plate armor and a gigantic sword that only he can wield, he is an indomitable force.

Warrior - Light Empire - Level 40

Scarlet Heartbeat (Ki, Counter) - Special Counter. If you achieve a successful Dodge, the counter gains +4 Attack / +2 Damage.

Both pewter figures are unpainted and unassembled.
97844.name: Anima Tactics: Light Faction Starter
boardgameexpansion: Anima Tactics Rulebook Saga I & II: Awakening & Rise

97845.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Galaxy Trucker: Another Big Expansion is just as big as the Big one: New tiles, new support team to be hired to enhance your shipbuilding experience, new ship classes, including huge IV ships.

Yes, you may also fly round IV, and you can be sure the cards are extra nasty there – especially the intruders that board your ship, wander around, and eat or blow up your stuff, unless your heroic crew beats them. Wait... that's a different game, right? Aren't we speaking rather about Space Alert now? Well...it seems this "let's board a ship and eat its crew" mode spreads pretty fast in the known universe these days, as with this expansion, it can happen also in Galaxy Trucker.
97845.name: Galaxy Trucker: Another Big Expansion

97846.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Bound by their ruthless philosophies and ambitions of power, Bael and Cheshire crush anyone in their path.

Cheshire:

One of the fallen cherubim of the breed of the Ebudan. Cheshire is so old he has forgotten even his true name. Gifted with a natural talent for annihilation and war, his inborn powers are terrifying.

Warrior - Dark Samael - Level 50

Excisun Aeris (Ki, Ranged Attack) - Ranged Attack (12 inch). +2 Attack / +2 Damage

Summun (Ki, Attack) - +4 Attack / +4 Damage.


========================================================

Shinigami Ayl:

As one of the dark spirits of death, Ayl combines strong magic abilities with an incredible combat skill. With her powers, she is able cast even the souls of living creatures into oblivion.

Dark Samael Warrior/Mystic - Lv. 50

At 5 | Dm 5 | Df 8 | Ar 1 | LP: 14 | Re 10 | Mo 8/12 | AP 3/4

ooo - Unholy Beam (Magic, Ranged Attack)
Distance (16 inch).

ooo - Mimic Damage (Magic, Effect, Reactive)
Cast when an enemy declares an attack on a friendly unit within your Control Zone. If the attack successfully causes damage to the friendly unit, apply the same damage to any enemy unit within your Control Zone. Effect 15.

ooo - Death Scythe (Magic, Attack)

+ 2 Attack. If Death Scythe causes any damage, target unit suffer Lv1 Doom. Effect 15.

Both pewter figures are unpainted and unassembled.
97846.name: Anima Tactics: Dark Faction Starter
boardgameexpansion: Anima Tactics Rulebook Saga I & II: Awakening & Rise

97848.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Black Sun Box Set includes Promethea Delacroix, Styx, Type-005, and a pamphlet to cover the unique rules used by some Black Sun figures.

Promethea Delacroix:

Though the world sees her as a rich and spoiled heir to the Delacroix fortune, who works as a top model for fun, there is far more to Promethea than that. Ruthless and intelligent, she is one of the most highly ranked officers of the Black Sun Corporation. Promethea uses her beauty and control of the most modern necromantic weapons to further her power and influence within the company.

Mystic - Dark Black Sun - Level 40

Guidance Points: 3

Amate Me (Magic, Effect) - An enemy unit inside Promethea's Control Zone suffers Doom Lv. 2. Effect 15.

Fonteius (Magic, Effect) - An enemy unit inside Promethea's Control Zone suffers Seal Lv. 1. Effect 15.

Rebelio (Magic, Effect, Reactive) - An Undead unit inside Promethea's Control Zone gets +2 Attack until end of turn.

Procedo Tute Met (Magic, Effect, Reactive) - This Ability can only be used during the Maintenence Phase, and only once per turn.
Ally Undead Units in Promethea's Control Zone get +2 inches to their Walk and Run speed until end of turn.

Styx:

Styx is Promethea's personal bodyguard. An undead hound developed by Black Sun labs, Styx is programmed to be unswervingly loyal to its master and is disguised to look like a normal living dog. Styx is a necromantic shadow tasked with destroying anything that could possibly be a menace to its owner.

Prowler/Undead - Neutral Black Sun - Level 25

Influence: 1
Uncontrollable: 1+

Bound: Only Promethea can spend Guidance points on Styx. While Promethea is in play, Styx ignores the Uncontrollable rule.

Stealth: (Subterfuge, Effect) - Styx becomes Hidden. Upkeep: O

Hubris: (Subterfuge, Attack) - +5 Attack. This attack can only be used if Styx is Hidden. If Hubris causes damage the target suffers Seal Lv. 1 Effect 14

Invidia (Subterfuge, Counter) - +2 Defense / +2 Attack / +2 Damage. This counterattack can only be used if Styx has just Intercepted a charge that originally targeted Promethea.

Nemesis: (Subterfuge, Charge, Reactive) - +3 Attack. This charge can only be used if a ranged attack targeting Promethea has just been resolved. This Charge must target the character who made the aforementioned ranged attack.

Type-005:

The Type-005 is the first real success of the Black Sun necromantic weapons program. An elite soldier of inhuman speed, strength, and resistance, a Type-005 is capable of creating animated blades and projectiles from its own bones.

Warrior/Undead - Neutral Black Sun - Level 20

Influence: 1 Uncontrollable: 10+

Innate Abilities: Damage Resistance
Availability: Type-005 aren't unique, you can include 1 for each 100 levels in the group.
Final Protocol: When the LP of a Type-005 reach 0, remove it from the game and put a counter the size of its base on its position. At the beginning of next turn's Action Phase, before any character's activation, all units within 2 inches of the counter receive an attack (Attack 5, Damage 5). Remove the counter after the attack resolves.

Bone Harpoon (Magic, Ranged Attack) - Distance (12 in.)

Chain of Bones (Magic, Effect) - A unit within 2 inches of Type-005 loses one Action Point. Effect 15.

The pewter figures are unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.
97848.name: Anima Tactics: Black Sun Box Set
boardgameexpansion: Anima Tactics Rulebook Saga I & II: Awakening & Rise

97849.name: Codename Cobra: Desert Storm
97849.description:
User Summary

In this game, you play as Michael, a helicopter pilot in the year 2012. Your mission is to stop the terrorist cell "Titan" from using suicide bombers all over Europe.

You will fly the Cobra helicopter around Europe and the Middle East. You will fly from one side of the screen to the other, battling enemy fighters, and avoiding their attacks, while upgrading your weapons.

97850.name: Six Pieds Sous Terre
97850.description:
From the game box:
A Hell of a game.

Each player, as an undertaker, is going to bury the most deceased in the graveyard to win the title of most famous living undertaker in town! You will have to follow the requirements of the families of the dead and to reserve the headstones to the graveyard before burying the dead, but you're not alone: tough negotiations and bids with your competitors await you!

The richest undertaker at the end of the game wins.

97851.name: Kroko Zoff
97851.description: Players roll the die and move their figures on the game board from the coast through the jungle to the small village to bring there some medicines. But they must beware of one big electronic crocodile moving along its way on the game board because sometimes their paths cross.

97852.name: Core Elements: Toolbox Edition
97852.description:
from the introduction:
When James announced his retirement from gaming — hopefully only temporarily — he generously turned over the bulk of his material to me. I've been a fan of his work for some time, and consider it a privilege to be able to carry the torch onward in his place.

This Toolbox Edition reprints the original Core Elements Revised published by James along with a collection of optional rules. These rules, contained in the sidebars and appendices (along with a few revisions in the core rules themselves) will assist gamemasters in customizing Core Elements to suit their campaigns.

I can only hope that this, the first of James' creations that I've had the opportunity to build on, will provide you with some good gaming.

97853.name: Simple20
rpghonor: 2006 Indie RPG Awards - Best Free Game - Runner Up
97853.description:
User summary:
Simple 20 is a generic game system inspired by d20 and BRP. It is simple in design, uses minimal rules and is easily adapted to any genre of gaming with a minimum of effort (depending on the level of detail desired).

These rules are the evolutionary descendant of James Hargrove's earlier Core Elements[/rpg]. These rules seem a little tighter and more distilled than in Core Elements[/rpg].

designer's notes from rules postscript"
This set of rules was inspired by several pre-existing works, including the World's Most Popular Roleplaying Game (now in its third edition), the World's Most Popular Percentile-Based Roleplaying Game (recently released under the OGL), Core Elements, and Scott Lininger's The Window (no kidding).

97854.name: Six Sided Sagas™
97854.description:
from the rules introduction:
Six-Sided Sagas is intended to be a simple fantasy roleplaying system that is easily adaptable to any setting that you may so choose to play in. The primary design goals of the system are ease of use and the facilitation of fun.
...
In order to play a game using the Six-Sided Sagas rules, you will need access to some pencils (or pens), paper, and several six-sided dice for each player. Outside of this the only requirements are a healthy imagination and a willingness to work cooperatively with others in an effort to have fun.

97855.name: Bronze
97855.description:
website blurb (@1km1kt):
Bronze is a set of rules designed to emulate swords and sorcery adventure in the vein of Lin Carter, Fritz Leiber, and Robert E. Howard. Bronze actually began life as Zak Arntson's Thord of Relings, a set of intriguing design notes that can be found over at the Harlekin Maus site. While attempting to play a game using those notes, several changes were made along the way and, ultimately, a new set of rules was born.

97856.name: Converting to Simple20
rpghonor: 2006 Indie RPG Awards - Best Free Game - Runner Up
97856.description:
from the introduction:
This is not a hard and fast set of rules but, rather, a set of guidelines for converting game material from other products released under the Open Game License into a form that is compatible with the Simple 20 system. You should feel free to both expand upon these guidelines as you see fir and igonore the parts that don't work for you.

97857.name: The Frostfur Captives
97857.description:
From the publisher's website:

Tasked with escorting a group of goblin prisoners from their camp to civilization for interrogation by the Pathfinder Society, you must protect them not only from the beasts and hazards of the wilderness, but themselves.

A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for Levels 1-5.

This scenario is designed for play in Pathfinder Society Organized Play, but can easily be adapted for use with any world. This scenario is compliant with the Open Game License (OGL) and is suitable for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

97858.name: Sewer Dragons of Absalom
97858.description:
From the publisher's website:

Absalom is Golarion’s busiest and most populace city, but one of its largest populations goes largely unnoticed. You must venture into the sewers beneath the City at the Center of the World to stop the meddling dragons within from disrupting a vital Pathfinder Society operation.

A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for Levels 3-7.

This scenario is designed for play in Pathfinder Society Organized Play, but can easily be adapted for use with any world. This scenario is compliant with the Open Game License (OGL) and is suitable for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

97859.name: The Ghenett Manor Gauntlet
97859.description:
From the publisher's website:

When the Pathfinder Society failed to obtain a valuable artifact from a wealthy Druman noble using diplomatic means, the eccentric collector challenged them to take it through skill from one of his well-guarded manors throughout the world. You are sent to Ghenett Manor in Katapesh with the hopes of surviving long enough to return with the prize-assuming it’s there at all.

A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for Levels 5-9.

This scenario is designed for play in Pathfinder Society Organized Play, but can easily be adapted for use with any world. This scenario is compliant with the Open Game License (OGL) and is suitable for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

97860.name: The Kortos Envoy
97860.description:
From the publisher's website:

The centaur tribes of the Isle of Kortos have long been an enigma to the people of Absalom. But the Pathfinder Society needs the help of one of the horsemen’s greatest heroes, in it falls to you to negotiate an agreement between the Decemvirate and the centaurs of the plains.

A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for Levels 7-11.

This scenario is designed for play in Pathfinder Society Organized Play, but can easily be adapted for use with any world. This scenario is compliant with the Open Game License (OGL) and is suitable for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

97861.name: Simple20 Appendices
97861.description:
User summary:
This document is a collection of appendices with various options for Simple20 games. The appendices included in this document are:

Appendix 1: Character options

Variable Point Totals
Random Ratings
Expanded Modifiers




Appendix 2: Basic Rules Options

Ten-sided Dice
Action Points




Appendix 3: Damage Options

Armor and Weapons
The Wound Track
Descriptive Damage




Appendix 4: Insanity Options

Mental Wound Track

97862.name: Darkspore
videogamefranchise: EA Value Games (Best Selling Electronic Arts Games, PAL)
97862.description:
User Summary:

"Dark Spore" takes the engine from Spore & makes a single player or co-operative action game in the style of Diablo out of it, with customisation of characters & persistent online progress through a series of levels mixing procedurally generated content & squad based gameplay.

97863.name: Монопол
97863.description:
This russian children's game is very similar to Monopoly.

The game board consists of thirty-five spaces. Twenty-two of them are properties (hotel, bakery, clinic, planetarium, etc.), other - special spaces with different functions (+500, bathhouse, lottery, cockroach racing, etc.) Most of special spaces are mini gamblings with dice rolling.

The object of the game is to become the wealthiest player.

Contents:
- 1 gameboard
- 6 pawns
- 1 dice
- colored tokens in 6 colors
- money

97864.name: Faction Wars
97864.description:
From the website:

Faction Wars is a skirmish game designed for 2 or more players and involves using 28mm miniatures on a table with some terrain to represent your forces. Each player has a squad of around 10 to 15 models with which to beat their opponent.

Most wargamers who are interested in the sci-fi genre will already have a large collection of suitable miniatures. Instead of having to buy more, you can use the ones you have got to play Faction Wars.

The game is very easy to learn, but still offers a level of detail that should engage even the most experienced wargamers. Faction Wars is set in the not-too-distant future, so some of the technology and weapons will be familiar, but with plenty of added science fiction to bring the universe to life.

The human race has escaped the clutches of Earth and colonised the galaxy. The invention of wormhole technology has allowed the vast gulfs of empty space to be crossed. However, this vastness is also leading to the downfall of the Commonwealth. The supreme political figure is the High Guardian, who is losing control over the rapidly expanding wave of colonisation. A number of factions, all with greatly different agendas and ideas battle against each other in small skirmishes right across the galaxy.

The rulebook contains:

* An introduction to the Inviroate Commonwealth of the Federated Worlds
* Background material on each of the 9 factions
* Plenty of colour photos and original artwork
* Rules for playing the game, plus some scenarios
* Stats and background for each faction to allow you to build up your squad
* Stats and background for Special Characters
* Lists of weapons, armour, equipment, skills and psionic abilities to equip your sqaud
* Suggestions for creating terrain and setting up your gaming table
* Rules for using vehicles within the game

97865.name: Modern Pentathlon
97865.description:
The original Pentathlon of the ancient Olympic Games were based on the ideal soldier of the time, skilled in running, jumping, wrestling, and throwing (javelin and discus). Thus Baron Pierre de Coubertin, the founder of the modern Olympic games, invented the Modern Pentathlon based on the ideal soldier of his time, recreating the experience of a 19th century cavalry soldier behind enemy lines: running, swimming, riding, and fighting (with pistol and sword). In the vein of Reiner Knizia's Decathlon, this is a collection of dice games loosely based off the real-life events.

The five events capture a wide spectrum dice game mechanics, including push-your-luck, calculated risks, bluffing, and set collection. Players who have read Dr. Knizia's book Dice Games Properly Explained will find the events draw upon various traditional games, but combine and develop their mechanics to place more emphasis on decisions than luck. For example, in the 200m Freestyle Swimming and Pistol Shooting events, players may continually purchase rerolls to mitigate bad luck but should consider the trade-off of how much that would benefit their opponents. In Epee Fencing, players always have exactly 7 points to allocate each round, and so the event is more about bluff and discerning their opponent's actions.

97867.name: Ursa Carrien
97867.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A new threat has surfaced in Cannibal Sector 2 and it's hungry .

The first of the Data Packets for SLA Industries from Nightfall Games, this six-page PDF contains a creature and a BPN for a group of operatives to prove their worth to the company.

97868.name: Klick's End
97868.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Klick's End - a Downtown area that SLA has left to rot. The dregs of society ruled by a dangerous quartet of Props where pig fighting and glue sniffing are all that's left to do.

Say hello to the pigs.

The second of the Data Packets from Nightfall Games, this ten-page PDF contains a setting, some Props and a BPN for the mysterious M.R. Division. Have you got what it takes?

97872.name: Hot Chicks 1
97872.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It's time to set up the battle map, the one that you're going to be looking at for the next few hours. It's time for Hot Chicks! These high-quality "Standie" figures will grace any battle, as front line fighters, hostages, villains or bystanders. Provided in varying states of dress and amounts of equipment, these Hot Chicks will spice up that battle map.

97873.name: Hot Chicks 2: A Space Fantasy
97873.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Once again, it's time to lay out the battle map... the one you're going to be rolling dice over for hours. Why not cover it in Hot Chicks? These forty-eight (48!) high-quality "Standees" portray women of the far future and futures that never were, in everything from form fitting powered armor to semi-revealing martial arts robes, and more! Usable as super heroines, soldiers of fortune, starship crew, or anything else you can imagine. Having a space battle? You need Hot Chicks 2: A Space Fantasy!

97874.name: Hot Chicks 3: Dangerous Curves
97874.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Once again, it's time to lay out the battle map... the one you're going to be rolling dice over for hours. Why not cover it in even more Hot Chicks?

These forty-eight (48!) high-quality "Standees" portray women of the deadliest sort - beautiful in demeanor and proportion, with big honkin' weapons to blow things away with! Each of these forty-eight dangerous beauties is individually crafted to carry a unique and gorgeous style to the battle map. From cyberpunk laser-rifle toting dolls to a cheerleader with a Schmeiser, these beauties can represent the pinnacle of danger and the essence of grace all at once.

So, if you're going to be staring at that map and rolling dice for the evening, why not stare at something that looks back seductively over the barrel of a gun? Why not spend the evening with the ladies of Hot Chicks 3: Dangerous Curves?

97875.description:
We are in the early XXth century, but the world is not as we know it. In 1895, exploring Amazonia, Auguste Copperpot discovered a gate to a lost valley, occupied by a primitive civilisation. Wiraqocha Valley was the name he gave to this remote Eden. This world enclosed a treasure that was going to revolutionize modern sciences, namely the Somnium, an orange luminescent crystal showing amazing properties. It can be used as fuel, affects matter and even time. Immediately, this virgin land became a new Eldorado for European colonists. Empress Victoria II decided to send several conglomerates to share this promised land and reap the fruits to her benefit. Zeppelin fleet, full of scientists, adventurers and looters, clouded the Atlantic sky.

Wiraqocha Valley is represented by an adjustable board consisting of 22 hexagonal tiles, each of them being identified by a number from 1 to 12, or a dice combo (pairs or straights). In his turn, each player rolls some six-sided dice, combining them to take possession of territories, or to protect from the opponents the ones he already owns. Every hexagon affords resources or special capacities, which are means to influence die results to fit one’s strategy. There are three ways to win: bring back a huge cargo of Somnium to the Empress; acquire enough scientific knowledge to build the Leviathan, a terrifying weapon serving the Kingdom; or find in the temple depths the four relics that will allow you to reach Wiraqocha’s treasure.
97875.name: Wiraqocha
boardgameexpansion: Wiraqocha: The Way of the Feathered Serpent

97876.name: Hot Chicks 3.1: Naked Distress
97876.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It's time to set out the battle map. You're going to be staring at this fight for the next few hours. What better thing to look at than HOT CHICKS... and what better way to keep your players' eyes on the map than with "Hot Chicks 3.1: Naked Distress?"

FOR MATURE GAMERS ONLY!

It's the figures from our popular "Hot Chicks 3: Dangerous Curves" set, in considerable trouble. In the tradition of classic Ral Partha figures, the ladies are naked and terrified - Damsels in distress, PCs on the wrong side of the fight, prisoners to be rescued, or extras in a B Horror movie - You Decide!

This set of Forty-Eight high quality 25mm paper "Standies" features women of beauty and strength in helplessness and distress. Each figure is crafted as an individual character with a unique identity, easily recognizable as one of the unique figures from our "Hot Chicks 3" set. Positions and facial expressions have been lovingly adjusted to reflect true distress. Scatter them throughout a dungeon for atmosphere, or lay them in front of Nameless Horrors as the perfect sacrifice.

Also ideal for portraying a female PC having a very, very bad day.

Need atmosphere? Need to keep your players focused on the map? Then you need "Hot Chicks 3.1: Naked Distress!"

97877.name: Hot Chicks 4: Ladies of the Night
97877.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It's time to set out the battle map. The one you're going to be looking at for the next few hours. While you're looking at it anyway, why not spice it up with some Hot Chicks?

Hot Chicks 4: Ladies of the Night!

This set of high quality 25mm Paper Miniatures feature forty-eight (48!) unique characters, beautiful women dressed as "ladies of the night," engaging in the world's oldest profession.

Whether you need random prostitutes, undercover law enforcement officers, or even gorgeous eye-candy bystanders, these ladies will keep your battle map pretty for hours at a time, and maybe give a table full of players inspirations for further "adventures!"

Setting out the battle map? Then you need "Hot Chicks 4: Ladies of the Night!"

97878.name: Stuff To Beat Up 1: Tech Terrors
rpgseries: Hot Chicks Stuff to Beat Up
97878.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It's time to set out the battle map; the one that you're going to be looking at for the next few hours. You need what EVERY battle needs... Stuff To Beat Up! These high quality "Standies" feature technological terrors, including troops in high-tech body armor with a variety of weapon load outs, sleek killer robots, and genetically modified battle-babes, complete with gear. Go up against bad guys with STYLE, and take them down like popcorn. There's plenty of them!

97879.name: Stuff To Beat Up 2: Killer Robots
rpgseries: Hot Chicks Stuff to Beat Up
97879.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It's time to set out the battle map; the one that you're going to be looking at for the next few hours. You need what EVERY battle needs... Stuff To Beat Up! These high quality "Standies" feature Killer Robots, with a variety of deadly weapons, in several designs. Choose from alloy endoskeletal structures, sleek high-tech combat models, sharp and fast close assault 'bots, or Heavy Firepower. Go up against bad guys with STYLE, and take them down like popcorn. There's plenty of them!

97880.name: Stuff To Beat Up 3: Walking Dead
rpgseries: Hot Chicks Stuff to Beat Up
97880.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It's time to set out the battle map; the map you're going to be looking at for the next few hours. You need what EVERY battle needs... Stuff To Beat Up! This set of Forty-Eight (48!) Paper "Standies" features the gruesome walking dead, both male and female, in various states of decay, ready to shamble into your map and give dire threat. Did you hear that? That voice on the winds, calling for "braaaaains?" It must be the Walking Dead!

97881.name: Stuff To Beat Up 4: The Axis Pack
rpgseries: Hot Chicks Stuff to Beat Up
97881.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It's time to set out the battle map; the map you're going to be looking at for the next few hours. You need what EVERY battle needs... Stuff To Beat Up! This set of Forty-Eight (48!) Paper "Standies" features two of the most popular enemies of all times... Nazis AND Ninjas! Whether you're encountering the Dark Shinobi of the mysterious East or quelling the rise of the Fourth Reich, you'll look GOOD doing it with the Axis Pack!

The set includes Twenty-Four (24) Ninja warriors with various implements of Martial Arts destruction, as well as Twenty-Four (24) Nazi soldiers in full Regalia.

If you're setting out the map, you're going to need "Stuff to Beat Up!"

97882.name: Stuff To Beat Up 5: Squads In Armor
rpgseries: Hot Chicks Stuff to Beat Up
97882.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It's time to set out the battle mat. You've got your heroes, you've drawn the building, what else do you need? You need what every battle needs.

Stuff To Beat Up!

This set of Forty-Eight high quality 25mm paper "Standies" features men and women in suits of high tech armor, armed for battle. Laser carbines and railgun rifles ready for mayhem on your battle map. Includes eight (8!) seperate six-person fire squads, easily identified by armor style and coloration.

Not only are there faceless armored minions, but included are three sets of Personalities; figures with a little more humanity for that slightly more human fight.

For use with sci-fi or modern gaming, or anywhere that eight six-person squads can do the most damage. Having a fight? Then you need Stuff to Beat Up!

97883.name: Hot Dudes 1
97883.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It's time to set out the battle map. The one that you're going to be looking at for the next few hours. When it's time to place your character, place a Hot Dude! These forty-eight (48!) high quality "Standies" feature studs in various degress of studliness, dressed in everything from three piece suits to high-tech body armor. When it's time to show off your inches of movement or your massive attack bonus, show it off with a Hot Dude - because you deserve to look GOOD while you kick ass and take names. These figures are suitable to represent everything from front-line fighting PCs to villains, hostages, and bystanders.

97884.name: The Hot Chicks Art Book
97884.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In our Standee sets "Hot Chicks 1" and "Hot Chicks 2: A Space Fantasy," you encountered 96 women of beauty and strength, in 25mm Scale. Now, in "The Hot Chicks Art Book," you can see all 96 of these figures in all of their glory and detail.

Ideal as a visual reference tool, this book provides character sketches for the Player and visual aids for the GM. Each figure, pictured front and back, is accompanied by text describing possible uses of the figure in a game, and the creative process involved in designing her.

Included in "The Hot Chicks Art Book" is bonus material; "sketches" of some of the base forms used in the creation of the figures, illustrations featuring key figures, and examples of what we can do once we have a figure defined.

Tired of the eye strain? Then you'll want "The Hot Chicks Art Book!"

97885.name: Hot Chicks Artbook 2: The Art of Dangerous Curves
97885.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In our Standee set "Hot Chicks 3: Dangerous Curves," you met 48 women of exceptional beauty, rare danger, and ridiculous amounts of firepower. There, they were scaled to 25mm. Now, see the full-sized graphics of the women of Dangerous Curves.

Ideal as a reference book, this tome provides chracter sketches for players and GMs alike, as well as providing commentary on the process of producing the figures, personalities, and possible uses of the figures in Roleplaying scenarios. Great for generating a quick bit of color for a campaign, as well as getting story seeds.

Included in "Hot Chicks Artbook 2: The Art of Dangerous Curves" are several pages of bonus material with still-life studies of our base models, notes on the creation of characters, some exceptionally dangerous cheesecake, and more!

Want to get close to danger? Get close to the women of "Dangerous Curves!"

97886.name: BattleTechnology (Issue 12 - Feb 3046)
rpgissuearticle: But Does It WANT To Change?
Flush and Flood, Mud and Blood
Star Vengeance! : The Ships That Never Were
Star Vengeance! : The Ships That Never Were
97886.description:
Cover headline: Silence From the Periphery?

Cover art: Marty Bingham

no 'Opening Shot' Editorial in this issue

Contents

Snow And Ashes
Caught In The Mech Flush
Inside Job
But Does It WANT To Change?

DEPARTMENTS
BattleTechnology News Service
In the News

Convention Calendar

BATTLETECH SIMULATOR
Valley of the Winds (Combined Arms)
Flush and Flood, Mud and Blood

>

97887.description:
From the publisher website:
The Boss is an expansion for Dust Tactics, the tactical miniatures board game of explosive battlefield combat! With The Boss, an Allied Rangers Command Squad, you’ll gain a new level of control over your Dust Tactics forces.

The Boss has the Command Squad ability, making it indispensable in overseeing your other forces. Their exceptional motivational skills even allow them to reactivate units that you’ve already used! What’s more, both squads have the Artillery Strike ability, meaning they can serve as spotters for any friendly tank armed with Artillery (as described in the Artillery rules in the Operation Cyclone Campaign Expansion)!

The Boss is a squad of Allied officers, and they’re on the battlefield to ensure that every order is perfectly executed. Like other Rangers, the Allied Command is equipped with assault rifles and a machine gun, but their real strength lies in their ability to coordinate the attacks of other units. Known for its powerful leadership capability, this unit is a high-priority target that must be protected at all costs. But used wisely, they’ll tip the balance in your favor!
97887.name: Dust Tactics: Rangers Command Squad – "The Boss"

97888.name: Monopoly: Doctor Who
97888.description: Limited to 5000 sets, Doctor Who Monopoly features all your favourite heroes, villains, monsters, planets and places.

97890.name: The Mission
97890.description:
From the Publisher:

Don't Stand in the Dark; Do Something Awesome!

What defines a hunter of hidden horrors? Is it the powers? The skills? The lore? Or is a true hero defined by what he does with those gifts?

Monster Hunters 2: The Mission picks up where Monster Hunters 1: Champions left off, presenting the rules and tips would-be hunters depend on to survive. This supplement includes:


An explanation of the usual situations champions encounter when facing their foes, complete with GURPS rules and guidelines. Learn how to hunt the horrors, investigate the inscrutable, pursue the perverse, and heal the heroes!
An in-depth look at cinematic creature-killing combat. Keep the bullets flying and the action furious with rules for simplifying gunplay, conquering curses, gathering gadgets, and more.
A new investigative system based on clues and deductions. Now the players or their characters have a chance to piece the puzzle together!
An extensive guide to what makes a Monster Hunters campaign work, and how to turn it up to 11. Create memorable monsters, evil organizations, and twisted plots to keep the hunters hopping!
Six sample campaign sketches to spark the imagination. Are the heroes enterprising exterminators, made men, or something stranger?


The question of who rules the night is still unresolved. But the rules themselves are here, in Monster Hunters 2: The Mission.

97891.name: Paradise Café
97891.description:
User Summary

Paradise Café was the first and only Portuguese game for the ZX Spectrum.

It is an adult game in which the player would interact with different characters, from the corner prostitute, to her pimp and police. If you manage to work your way around you would earn money to spend, and if you overspent you could count that eventually a big guy named Reinaldo would interact with you.

97893.name: Flight of the Intruder
97893.description:
Flight of the Intruder is based on the movie of the same name (which, in turn, was based on a novel). Developed by Rowan Software, Ltd. and published by Spectrum Holobyte, the game allowed players the choice of flying either the A-6 Intruder or F-4 Phantom from aircraft carriers against targets in North Vietnam. The player's task was to configure the planes and to plan and execute each mission, commanding multiple sections of each plane. The player configures each plane's loadout, plans the mission package, then flies the mission.

Players were challenged both by the comprehensive enemy defenses and the restrictive and complex rules of engagement. Realistic features included unreliable missiles and smokey engines for the Phantom. (As in real life, the trail would disappear in afterburner.) At lower realism settings, F-4's had missiles and an internal cannon - in contrast to real USN whose F-4's were armed only with missiles.

Source: Wikipedia, "Flight of the Intruder", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Source: Wikipedia, "Flight of the Intruder (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

97894.name: The Fema Su
97894.description:
Publisher's blurb:

They Are the Fema Su

They look like anyone you want them to look like... a perfect companion, a perfect lover, and a perfect imposter.

Their race is facing a horrible dead-end in their evolution, and the only cure that exists is to interbreed with humanity.

They have been here for thousands of years; studying us, seducing us, taking on our forms, worming their way into our society, and breeding with us.

When it comes right down to it, humanity isn't really getting a bad deal...

...unless you count the endless complications and turmoil that a relationship with your perfect alien love-partner can bring. Surviving the mating is one thing - but when your perfect alien lover shows up on your doorstep because they're being chased by men in black suits, the "morning after" can be a real killer!

This book introduces the Fema Su race into the world of Earth in 2015, complete with statistics for several Fema Su, their agents, and their monstrous living starships.

No one-night-stand will ever be the same again...

This is a supplement for HOT CHICKS: The Roleplaying Game. You will need the core rulebook in order to play.

This is the second of our "Alien Files" books, in which we detail one of the many alien races that threatens the state of Humanity in the year 2015. In this edition, we highlight the sensuous and dangerous Fema Su, and their heroic attempt to head off the evolutionary dead-end of their race, using human genes to shape their future.

Included are descriptions of the various classes of Fema-Su operative, their equipment, networks, and ships. Stats for various Fema Su operatives are also included.

Then, we finish up with a a bucket of adventure seeds based around the Fema Su and their works.

Thirty Pages, lavishly illustrated. Because if you're going to have hot aliens, you need pictures of hot aliens!

97895.name: The Swedish Bikini Assassin Team
97895.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"In 2012, several female corporate operatives were convicted of crimes that they may or may not have committed. They eventually escaped from a minimum security facility near Stockholm and hid in the Swedish underground, from where they operate as killers for hire. If you need someone killed, if you like hot Swedish chicks, and if you can find them, maybe you can hire the Swedish Bikini Assassin Team."

This is a supplement for Hot Chicks: The Roleplaying Game - you will need the core rulebook to play.

Here you will find three of the deadlist women Sweden has yet produced, who have joined forces for the sheer joy of killing and making money off of it. With their mysterous benefactor, they can be enemies, or allies, or even very, very complicated love interests. Don't say you haven't been warned.

Includes three fully realized characters suitable for use as NPCs or advanced Player Characters, background story, and bonus illustrations.

So what are you waiting for? Come on in, the water's fine!

97896.name: Pyramid (Volume 3, Issue 30 - Apr 2011)
rpgissuearticle: Eidetic Memory: Mass Combat in Space
Random Thought Table: Home is a Starfaring Castle
97896.description:
Spaceships

From the publisher:

Your Ticket to the Stars!

Let's face it: If you had any plans for leaving our world, you'd need a spaceship. This month's Pyramid -- the PDF magazine for roleplayers -- is devoted to the craft, captains, and complications of interplanetary travel. This issue's itinerary will take you to the following destinations:


"Practical Astromancy," a look at off-world exploits in GURPS Technomancer. Written by Kenneth Peters (author of Transhuman Space: Spacecraft of the Solar System), this guide includes details of that setting's solar system -- including the moon's Kennedy Base -- plus descriptions of how its magic-fueled spaceships work. It provides full GURPS Spaceships stats for the Trailblazer-class survey ship and the Yetzirah-class space station.
"One With the Ship," presenting cyber-powered possibilities for spaceship pilots. This article includes a full 150-point GURPS template for the interface pilot, plus customization notes, new cybernetics that augment the implant options from GURPS Ultra-Tech, optional advantages and rules for interfacing with a vessel, a sample pilot, and more!
"Mass Combat in Space," this month's Eidetic Memory offering from GURPS Fourth Edition co-author David Pulver. With these optional rules, you can combine GURPS Spaceships with the large-scale-combat system from GURPS Mass Combat and conquer the galaxy!
"Sky Galleys," a look at the impossible interplanetary craft that populate the Roma Universalis setting (first seen in Pyramid #3/20: Infinite Worlds). Use the optional new Spaceships components to build their astral armadas, board one of the two constructed vessels, and use one of the three GURPS templates to gather your crew. For the glory of Rome, the void awaits!
"Hunter-Gatherer," an off-world experience set aboard a derelict starship. Written by Stephen Dedman (co-author of GURPS Space Atlas 4), this adventure includes full GURPS stats for the enigmatic titular vehicle and nine alien lifeforms who will make life difficult for the explorers.


This Pyramid also presents Murphy's Rules with Greg Hyland, Steven Marsh's Random Thought Table, and other odds and ends. Fly into tomorrow in style with this issue!

Visit the official web page for more info, resources, product support, and links.

97897.name: Unnecessary Roughness
97897.description:
From the CD jewel case

"Neon" Dion Sanders. Junior Seau. Thurman Thomas. Michael Irvin. John Taylor. Sterling Sharpe. Just six of the NFLPA(TM) stars ready to knock you flat on your grass in Unnecessary Roughness(TM)-the hardest hitting way to play football without getting hurt. Call the shots from a rotating 3-D game orientation that actually puts you on the field. Choose plays from a playbook that's thicker than a lineman's skull. And if all that doesn't make it real enough for you, you'll even find sportscasting legends Al Michaels behind the mike for the play-by-play. So get psyched. Or get sacked. Because Unnecessary Roughness is as real as it gets.

97898.description:
Steam Lords is a game of resource management for 2 ruthless players. To win you must use your resources wisely to construct 12 victory points worth of buildings along the Shale River which runs through the different quarters of the City of Iron.

Needed to play: the deck of 34 cards and 35 markers per player in 2 colors.

Setup: Place the 4 Quarter Cards comprising the map of the Shale River between players.

The 4 quarters of the city each have 6 buildings on them that can be constructed by players. Each building is worth 1 victory point towards the goal of 12. Further, each building allows players to use the special power of that quarter of the city to place more workers, distribute resources or purchase cards in the game.

Next each player takes a set of the 5 Industry Cards: Foundry, Trade Guild, Civil Service, Builders and Shipwrights and places them below their side of the river.

Industry Cards are used to construct the buildings along the river by placing resources on the 5 icons on each card. Once enough resources have been accrued, players may construct one of the buildings, though each industry type only constructs one or two particular types of building based on which Quarter Cards the industries are adjacent to.

Next each player takes a set of the 4 Resource Cards: Brick Kiln, Textile Mill, Lumbermill and Smelter. Players shuffle these cards and randomly lay them out below the Industry Cards. Place the Contract Card within reach of both players. Then lay out the 11 Upgrade Cards face up within reach of both players.

Lastly, players each take 4 of their 30 eurocube markers and place them on four icons on any of their Industry Cards. Players may only place a marker on one each of the four resource types. Each card shows icons for a different resource type used in the game to construct the buildings and purchase upgrade cards.

Play: Steam Lords is divided into rounds of four phases. Players take turns during phases 1, 3 and 4, and play simultaneously during phase 2. Players will alternate going first between rounds, with Player One going first in the first round, Player Two going first in the 2nd round, etc... Once all 4 phases have been completed, a new round begins.

Phase 1: Contract
Players take turns placing 5 workers (eurocube markers) on the Contract Card claiming either resources or distribution rights.
Phase 2: Distribute
Players simultaneously distribute resources, moving markers from the Resource Cards to the Industry Cards.
During this phase, each player may ‘deliver’ any resources for a total of 5 card units in distance. To calculate distance, count the number of cards up and over to the left or right you wish to move a resource.
Phase 3: Build
Players take turns constructing buildings on the Quarter Cards if they have all 5 resources needed on their Industry Cards.
If a player has all 5 icons marked on an Industry Card, they may remove those markers and construct any of the unclaimed buildings on a Quarter Card. Once all 6 buildings have been constructed no more can be claimed. Each building built on a Quarter Card is worth 1VP.
Phase 4: Upgrade
Players take turns buying Upgrade Cards one at a time, and may only buy Upgrade Cards if they have built buildings in Coalside during phase 3. For each building built in Coalside, a player may buy 1 Upgrade Card during this phase. To purchase an Upgrade Card, a player must pay the number of resources shown at the bottom of each Upgrade Card. They may then take the card and place it in front of them.

Four of the Upgrade Cards allow players to store additional resources on the Resource Cards. After purchasing one of the four cards replace the existing Resource Card with the new one. Each of these cards is worth 2VP. Seven of the Upgrade Cards let you construct building with fewer resources, gain distribution units or place more workers in phase 1. The cards list their respective upgrades.

An expanded set of 12 additional cards has also been included for a longer game.

Artscow direct order - http://www.artscow.com/gallery/playing-cards/steam-lords-wym...
97898.name: Steam Lords

97899.name: Zubo
97899.description:
Zubo is a rhythm-action videogame developed by EA Bright Light Studios for Nintendo DS. It combines strategic rock-paper-scissors battles with rhythm mechanics, with stronger attacks requiring more complex inputs with the stylus.

Source: Wikipedia, "Zubo", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

97900.name: Noval
97900.description:
Noval is the quick playing family-friendly strategy game with suspenseful play and comfortably shaped cards. No batteries, boards, pencils, or score keeping. Play in under 30 minutes! Match or beat each others cards in a race to be the first empty-handed player! Great for family game nights or get-togethers. Noval's portable size makes it great for fun on the go. Grab the box, slide it into a pocket or purse, go have some fun!

Nine cards are dealt to each player who then select 3 cards at random without looking at their hands and place them face-down in front of themselves. These cards remain there until later in the game. Players must then match or beat each others cards to get rid of their hands and win! Cards like BURN and WILD add a twist of excitement while High cards (BRONZE, SILVER, GOLD, and DIAMOND) are used to force other players to pick up piles of cards.

97901.name: Harvest Moon DS: Island of Happiness
97901.description:
Harvest Moon DS: Island of Happiness is a farm simulation video game published and developed by Marvelous Entertainment in Japan, and released in North America by Natsume exclusively for the Nintendo DS. It is the third installment of the Harvest Moon series on the DS.

Source: Wikipedia, "Harvest moon island of happiness", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

97902.name: Harvest Moon DS: Sunshine Islands
97902.description:
Harvest Moon DS: Sunshine Islands is a video game that was released on February 21, 2008 in Japan and December 7, 2009 in North America. As the seventeenth installment of the Harvest Moon series, and the fourth available for the Nintendo DS, the game closely resembles Harvest Moon DS: Island of Happiness, as the island setting in Island of Happiness is one of multiple islands in this game. The player can choose to be a boy (Mark) or a girl (Chelsea).

Source: Wikipedia, "Harvest Moon DS: Sunshine Islands", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgamehonor: 2013 Golden Geek Best Board Game Artwork/Presentation Nominee
2013 Golden Geek Best Family Board Game Nominee
2013 Golden Geek Best Party Board Game Nominee
2013 Golden Geek Most Innovative Board Game Nominee
97903.description:
In Terror in Meeple City (formerly known as Rampage), you arrive in Meeple City as a gigantic, famished, scaly-skinned monster! Your goal: Dig your claws and dirty paws into the asphalt, destroy buildings, and devour innocent meeples – in short: sow terror while having fun. The monster who has caused the most damage after the carnage finally ends wins the game.

The buildings in Meeple City are comprised of floor tiles and meeples, with the meeples serving as pillars that support the floors. Four wooden vehicles are on the ground in the eight neighborhoods in the city. Each monster, which consists of a wooden paws disc and a wooden body, starts in one corner of the game board. On a turn you take two actions from four possibilities, repeating an action if desired:


Move: Pick up your monster body, flick the paws disc, then place the body back on the disc.
Demolish: If your paws are on the sidewalk surrounding a building, you can pick up your monster body, drop it onto a building, then collect any floors that have no meeples on them.
Toss a vehicle: If you're in a neighborhood with a vehicle, you can pick up the vehicle, place it on your body, then flick the vehicle at a building or another monster.
Breathe: Even while away from sidewalks with no vehicles, you can cause destruction by placing your chin on your monster's body and blowing across the board.


Monsters tend to be messy when obtaining meals, but if you knock meeples off the city board, you might be punished for letting food go to waste, costing you a tooth or letting other players take an additional action. After your two actions, you can eat unprotected meeples on the ground in your neighborhood, but you can eat only as many as the number of teeth you have. If you knock another monster to the ground, you break off one of its teeth, thereby keeping it from stealing your food! Meeples come in six colors, with the colors representing different types of inhabitants: blue (journalists), green (military), yellow (blondes), grey (old people), red (heroes), and black (businessmen). For each set of six you collect in your stomach, you score 10 points at game's end. You score points for collecting floors and teeth, too, and you can also score for achieving the goal on your character card.

In addition to the character card, each player has a power card and a superpower card unique to his monster, with the former lasting the entire game and the latter being a one-shot effect that's revealed only upon use.

Terror in Meeple City includes rules for monsters that evolve over the course of the game, that lose points for meeples not in sets, and that want to combine two game boards to allow for play with up to eight players.
97903.name: Terror in Meeple City
boardgameexpansion: Terror in Meeple City: The Space Cowboys

The Game Pit: Episode 27 - Top Ten from 2013
TPGC - Episode #29 - Rampage, Disc Duelers and Fastrack

97904.name: Lux-Pain
97904.description:
Lux-Pain is a visual novel-type adventure video game developed by Killaware and published by Marvelous Entertainment for the Nintendo DS video game console. The game was released in Japan on March 27, 2008. It was published in North America by Ignition Entertainment on March 24, 2009, and in Europe by Rising Star Games on March 27, 2009.

Source: Wikipedia, "Lux Pain", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

97905.name: Argentinosaurus
97905.description:
From the PDF:
This beast is so large it almost defi es imagination. It is a mountain of living fl esh well over 100 feet in length from its blunt-snouted head to the tip of its long, lashing tail. It lumbers along on four Cyclopean legs, literally shaking the earth with each mammoth footfall.

The Argentinosaurus is a 2-page PDF detailing the largest land-animal ever known to have existed, with stats for the Pathfinder RPG system.

97906.name: Super Robot Taisen OG Saga: Endless Frontier
97906.description:
Super Robot Wars OG Saga: Endless Frontier is a video game of Banpresto, co-developed with Monolith Soft, the studio behind the Xenosaga series. It is a spin-off of the Super Robot Wars: Original Generation series. Released on May 29, 2008 on the Nintendo DS, the title departs from the traditional tactical role-playing game elements for which the Super Robot Wars franchise is known and opts for turn-based role-playing gameplay instead.

Source: Wikipedia, "Super Robot Taisen OG Saga: Endless Frontier", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

97907.name: A Game of Thrones: Genesis
videogamefranchise: A Song of Ice and Fire
97907.description:
"A Game of Thrones – Genesis", Cyanide Studio’s new strategy game for PC, adaptation in a video game of the successful saga A Song of Ice and Fire by George R.R Martin, finally unveils itself! We invite you today to discover the two very first screenshots taken from this real-time strategy game, in which your political prowess will be as important as your strategic and military skills!

Thanks to a well-developed single player campaign written under supervision of the author George R.R. Martin, "A Game of Thrones – Genesis" immerses you into the heart of the battles and intrigues between the Houses that shaped the Kingdom of Westeros. Live the origins of the A Song of Ice and Fire saga through more than 1000 years of History, and take part in Westeros’ founding events and largest battles such as Aegon the Conqueror’s invasion on the continent or the War of the Usurper.

In this great strategy game, victory does not necessarily result from brute force. You can choose to use a military approach and besiege your opponents, strangle them in an economical war, or even use dirty tricks and diplomacy to politically crush them. Treachery and deception are everywhere, so watch your back and prepare for battle!

Source: The Developer Website.
